newsitem.title: CANADA: Sherritt to buy Dynatec, spin off unit.
newsitem.headline: Sherritt to buy Dynatec, spin off unit.

text.p: Sherritt International Corp said on Tuesday that its wholly-owned metallurgical technologies business plans to acquire all outstanding shares of Dynatec International Ltd, a private mining and drilling services company, and spin off the merged company.
The new company to be formed by the merger of Sherritt International Consultants Inc and Dynatec will be called Dynatec Corp.

Sherritt said it is filing with Canadian securities regulators a preliminary prospectus for a divided-in-kind to its shareholders of all of its interest in Dynatec, after which it will no longer hold any Dynatec securities.
Dynatec Corp will be a publicly traded Canadian company, with Dynatec Intl's management retaining a significant equity interest in the company.
W. Robert Dengler will be president and chief executive officer of Dynatec, Sherritt said.
Sherritt's Cuba interests have caused it problems because of U.S. trade laws that penalize such activities.
